title: Draft Pick Thoughts
body:
All in all the way the draft pick is implemented in the LCU is quite reasonable. I don't have a need for quotes or animations, really, so I won't comment on those beyond saying that I didn't have any issues and they seem fine. Regarding the looks, I have to say that I hate the new role icons with a passion. While they are still distinctive and get the job done, I just preferred the more round versions in the Legacy client. I'm also not particularly fond of the squares in the circles. 
http://i.imgur.com/Jf31dkD.png
Since those are the roles for Summoner's rift, wouldn't it make sense to make those icons based on the imagery you already have for it?
http://i.imgur.com/xCzZMrT.png

What seems to be missing is the visual representation of my position on the map. Neither in the introductory animation, nor in the later part of champion select are they present.

http://i.imgur.com/gFtYIhD.png vs. http://i.imgur.com/vxGdG2w.png

and

http://nynaeve.de/2016-08/LeagueClientUx_2016-08-30_18-31-47.png  vs. http://i.imgur.com/fiwvGnZ.png

While in the first instance, I don't particularly need those icons, it makes a lot more sense to have them. For the second example, I found this to be a very welcome addition when the new champion select shipped earlier this year, as I don't have to search the list for the role I want to look at, but can find them at always the same place on that map. Bring back, please!

replies.body: Role assignment and communication is definitely something that we are still working on. I have had the same thoughts as you and we're exploring ways to make that more clear.

It's too late, Rito committed too deep.

Nah but forreal tho, I agree with you these are solid complaints and I hope Riot changes it so there is more clarity in champ select.
As for the deal with role icons, I feel like they're just so fat that it looks nasty when the icons are in their respective role slots.
